content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
No compound structures have been successfully created on the map. The agent made several attempts to establish a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) in order to supply Automation Science Packs for research, but all such attempts failed because no Lab item was available and required sub‐ingredients were missing. Although retrieval operations referenced pre‐existing smelting facilities (an alternative furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)) for resource processing, none of these were newly built structures assembled by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Incorrect API usage for get_entities:
  – Avoid using unexpected keywords (e.g. “radius”) or supplying extra positional arguments. Verify the function signature and adjust the call parameters accordingly.

• Lab placement failures:
  – Ensure the Lab item is present in the inventory before attempting to place it at (0.5, 2.5).
  – Validate that the targeted placement area is free and that the intended entity exists.

• Handling missing entity collections:
  – Prevent iteration errors (such as “NoneType object is not iterable”) by checking that returned entity lists are not None or by using a safe fallback (e.g. an empty list) when no matching entities are found.

• Ingredient shortages during Lab crafting:
  – Confirm that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are produced in sufficient quantities.
  – Ensure that the production chain—including necessary smelting or crafting machines—is operational before initiating Lab production.

• Resource production dependencies:
  – Address errors stating that items (like copper-plate) cannot be crafted by verifying that appropriate machinery or furnaces are available to process raw inputs into the required resources.
